txt.en: Your mere words inspire others of your greatness
Valthor considers pride in one's own abilities paramount to a champion.

'Your skill in battle cannot be denied, [placeholder].

'The difference between a good champion and a great one is their renown. The peoples of Middle-earth need to know that there are warriors out there capable of incredible martial prowess, risking their lives to fight the enemy.

'For your second task, I want you to travel to Thorin's Hall. Ascend the steps toward Dwalin's throne and proclaim your prowess as a champion to all gathered in the halls of the dwarves!'
Dwalin's throne is in Thorin's Hall, far to the west of Moria.\n\nValthor has instructed you to go forth and boast of your great deeds before the throne of Dwalin.
'Well done, well done!\n\n'Now, [placeholder], for your next task.'
Thrymur is near Dwalin's throne in Thorin's Hall.\n\nThrymur was not impressed with you. You should speak with him again and proclaim your great deeds.
Valthor is at the Shadowed Refuge in Khazad-dûm, far to the east of Thorin's Hall.\n\nThrymur told you to return to Valthor in Moria and repeat what you said to him.
That's all well and good, [placeholder]; but you have much to learn about the telling of a tale.  \n\nYour deeds are impressive, but impress me with your words, if you can.
'Well said, [placeholder]. Your proud words show you to be a great warrior in my eyes.\n\n'Return to Valthor in Khazad-dûm and tell him what you have said here today. It will impress even him.'
Proclaim your prowess in Thorin's Hall
Talk to Thrymur at Thorin's Hall
Talk to Valthor at the Shadowed Refuge in Moria
